name: Linear Algebra
title: Study of linear equations, matrices, vector spaces, and linear transformations, forming the foundation for many areas of mathematics and its applications

name: Probability Theory
title: Mathematical study of random phenomena, probability distributions, and stochastic processes essential for statistics and machine learning

name: Information Theory
title: Mathematical study of quantification, storage, and communication of information, including entropy, data compression, and channel capacity

name: Numerical Optimization
title: Study of algorithms and methods for finding minimum or maximum values of mathematical functions, crucial for machine learning and engineering

name: Distributed Systems Fundamentals
title: Core principles of distributed computing, including consistency, availability, fault tolerance, and distributed consensus

name: Applied Cryptography
title: Practical implementation of cryptographic algorithms and protocols for securing data and communications

name: Machine Learning Foundations
title: Fundamental concepts of machine learning including supervised/unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and basic algorithms

name: Representation Learning
title: Study of learning data representations that make it easier to extract useful information for machine learning tasks

name: Deep Learning
title: Neural network architectures, training techniques, and applications in various domains like computer vision and natural language processing

name: Deep RL
title: Integration of deep learning with reinforcement learning for training agents through neural networks in complex environments

name: Large Language Models
title: Architecture, training, and application of large-scale transformer models for natural language processing tasks

name: Statistics
title: Collection, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of data, including hypothesis testing and statistical inference

name: Calculus
title: Study of continuous change, including derivatives, integrals, and infinite series, fundamental to mathematical modeling

name: Graph Theory
title: Mathematical study of graphs and networks, including connectivity, paths, and structural properties

name: Convex Optimization
title: Study of minimizing convex functions over convex sets, with applications in machine learning and operations research

name: Non‑Convex Optimization
title: Advanced optimization techniques for non-convex problems, including gradient-based methods and global optimization

name: Randomized Algorithms
title: Design and analysis of algorithms that make random choices to solve problems efficiently

name: Complexity Theory
title: Study of computational resource requirements and limitations of algorithms and problems

name: Number Theory
title: Study of integers and their properties, fundamental to cryptography and computer science

name: Abstract Algebra
title: Study of algebraic structures like groups, rings, and fields, with applications in cryptography and coding theory

name: Differential Privacy Foundations
title: Mathematical framework for sharing information about datasets while withholding information about individuals

name: Data Structures & Algorithms
title: Fundamental computer science concepts covering data organization and algorithm design for efficient problem solving

name: Systems Programming (C/Rust)
title: Low-level programming focusing on memory management, system calls, and performance optimization

name: Concurrent Programming
title: Design and implementation of programs with multiple concurrent threads of execution

name: GPU Programming (CUDA)
title: Programming for graphics processing units using CUDA framework for parallel computing

name: Parallel Programming
title: Design and implementation of programs that execute simultaneously on multiple processors

name: Operating System Kernels
title: Core concepts of operating system design including process management, memory management, and file systems

name: Virtualization
title: Technologies and techniques for creating virtual machines and managing system resources

name: Cloud‑Native Architecture
title: Design principles for scalable, resilient applications optimized for cloud environments

name: Consensus Algorithms (Paxos/Raft)
title: Algorithms for achieving agreement in distributed systems despite failures

name: Distributed Storage Systems
title: Design and implementation of scalable, fault-tolerant storage systems across multiple nodes

name: Query Optimization
title: Techniques for improving database query performance through execution plan optimization

name: Networking (TCP/IP Advanced)
title: Advanced concepts in computer networking, protocols, and network programming

name: Software‑Defined Networking
title: Network architecture that makes networks programmable through software abstractions

name: Large‑Scale Data Processing
title: Techniques and systems for processing massive datasets across distributed computing clusters

name: Edge Computing
title: Computing paradigm that brings computation and data storage closer to the location of data generation

name: Post‑Quantum Cryptography
title: Cryptographic systems that are secure against both quantum and classical computers

name: Homomorphic Encryption
title: Encryption systems that allow computation on encrypted data without decryption

name: Binary Exploitation
title: Techniques for finding and exploiting vulnerabilities in binary programs

name: Reverse Engineering
title: Analysis of compiled software to understand its structure, behavior, and vulnerabilities

name: Fuzzing
title: Automated software testing technique that finds vulnerabilities by providing invalid or random data

name: Side‑Channel Attacks
title: Attacks based on information gained from physical implementation of computer systems

name: Trusted Execution Environments
title: Secure areas within processors that guarantee code and data loaded inside is protected

name: Hardware Security
title: Security aspects of hardware design, implementation, and verification

name: Threat Intelligence
title: Collection and analysis of information about current and potential attacks threatening an organization

name: Differential Privacy (Applied)
title: Practical implementation of differential privacy techniques in real-world applications

name: Adversarial Machine Learning
title: Study of machine learning vulnerabilities and techniques to make models robust against attacks

name: Supervised Learning
title: Machine learning paradigm using labeled data to train models for prediction tasks

name: Unsupervised Learning
title: Machine learning techniques for finding patterns and structure in unlabeled data

name: Self‑Supervised Learning
title: Training paradigm where supervision comes from the data itself rather than explicit labels

name: Probabilistic Graphical Models
title: Framework for representing and reasoning about complex probability distributions using graphs

name: Bayesian Nonparametrics
title: Bayesian methods with infinite-dimensional parameter spaces for flexible model complexity

name: Variational Inference
title: Techniques for approximating complex probability distributions in Bayesian inference

name: Reinforcement Learning
title: Training agents to make sequences of decisions through interaction with an environment

name: Prompt Engineering
title: Techniques for effectively instructing and controlling large language models through input design

name: Distributed Training for LLMs
title: Techniques for training large language models across distributed computing resources

name: Model Compression & Acceleration
title: Methods for reducing model size and improving inference speed while maintaining performance

name: MLOps
title: Practices for deploying and maintaining machine learning models in production environments

name: Data Warehousing
title: Design and implementation of large-scale data storage systems for analytics and reporting

name: ETL Pipelines
title: Systems for extracting, transforming, and loading data between different storage systems

name: Streaming Data Processing
title: Processing and analyzing data in real-time as it arrives from continuous sources

name: Feature Stores
title: Systems for managing and serving machine learning features in production environments

name: Data Orchestration (Airflow)
title: Tools and techniques for scheduling and managing complex data processing workflows

name: Game Theory
title: Mathematical study of strategic decision making and interactions between rational agents

name: Approximation Algorithms
title: Algorithms that find approximate solutions to optimization problems that are hard to solve exactly

name: Functional Programming
title: Programming paradigm treating computation as mathematical functions without state or mutable data

name: Distributed Databases
title: Database systems that store and process data across multiple computers

name: Network Function Virtualization
title: Virtualizing network services traditionally performed by dedicated hardware

name: Hardware Accelerators (TPU)
title: Specialized hardware processors designed to accelerate specific types of computations

name: Cryptanalysis
title: Study of methods to break or bypass cryptographic security systems

name: Secure Multiparty Computation
title: Cryptographic protocols allowing multiple parties to jointly compute functions while keeping inputs private

name: Web Security
title: Security principles and practices specific to web applications and services

name: Malware Analysis
title: Techniques for analyzing malicious software to understand its behavior and capabilities

name: Supply Chain Security
title: Security measures for protecting software and hardware supply chains from attacks

name: Digital Forensics
title: Collection and analysis of digital evidence for security incidents and investigations

name: Incident Response
title: Methodologies for detecting, investigating, and responding to security incidents

name: Zero Trust Architecture
title: Security model that requires strict verification for every person and device trying to access resources

name: Blockchain Security
title: Security aspects of blockchain systems including consensus, smart contracts, and cryptographic protocols

name: Generative Models (VAE/GAN/Diffusion)
title: Deep learning models capable of generating new data samples similar to training data

name: Graph Neural Networks
title: Neural networks that operate on graph-structured data for tasks like node classification and link prediction

name: Causal Inference for ML
title: Methods for understanding and leveraging cause-effect relationships in machine learning

name: Offline RL
title: Reinforcement learning techniques that work with previously collected data without environment interaction

name: Multi‑Agent RL
title: Reinforcement learning in systems with multiple interacting agents

name: Meta‑Learning
title: Training models that can quickly adapt to new tasks with minimal data

name: Continual Learning
title: Methods for training models that can learn continuously from a stream of data without forgetting

name: Retrieval‑Augmented Generation
title: Enhancing language model outputs by incorporating information from external knowledge sources

name: Alignment & RLHF
title: Techniques for aligning language models with human values and preferences

name: AutoML
title: Automated methods for selecting and optimizing machine learning models and pipelines

name: Federated Learning
title: Training machine learning models across decentralized devices while keeping data local

name: Differentially Private ML
title: Machine learning methods that preserve privacy through differential privacy guarantees

name: Explainable AI
title: Methods for understanding and interpreting decisions made by machine learning models

name: Responsible AI & Fairness
title: Principles and techniques for developing AI systems that are ethical, fair, and transparent

name: Computational Physics
title: Introduction to numerical methods and simulations for solving physics problems computationally.

name: Statistical Mechanics
title: Study of large-scale behavior of systems from a probabilistic and information-theoretic perspective.

name: Quantum Mechanics
title: Fundamentals of quantum theory, wave functions, and applications to modern computing concepts.

name: Electromagnetism
title: Analysis of electric and magnetic fields and their interactions with matter and circuits.

name: Thermodynamics
title: Principles of energy, heat transfer, and work, with applications to statistical models.

name: Signal Processing
title: Techniques for analyzing, filtering, and reconstructing signals in time and frequency domains.

name: Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
title: Exploration of nonlinear systems, chaotic behavior, and their implications for complex models.
